answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources you might find useful.
The City of Windsor Heights, IA has implemented a self-funded health insurance program.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/102136/Selffunded_Health_Insurance
Below is a report from the City of Stockton, CA discussing how they used a self-funded health insurance plan.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301965
I also included the New York State Cooperative Health Insurance Purchasing policy. 
http://www.nyslocalgov.org/pdf/Cooperative_Health_Insurance_Purchasing.pdf
The City of Henderson, NV has also been considering a self-funded health insurance plan and has created a committee to oversee it.
http://www.cityofhenderson.com/human_resources/docs/self_funded_insurance_committee/Self-Funded_Insurance_Committee_By-Laws%20_8-2008_signed.pdf
And this is their homepage.
http://www.cityofhenderson.com/human_resources/self-funded_employee_health_insurance_committee.php
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

answers.author: Thomas Guerino
answers.text:
The Town of Bourne, Ma.  has been self insured for decades.  The Town's trending over the past 5 years is less than a 2% annual rate of growth with very good coverages and most reasonable co-pays.  I recommend you speak with the Town Treasurer in Bourne.

author: Jeffrey French
text: We are considering implementing self-funding for health insurance.  I would be appreciative of any policies, procedures, etc that your municipality has implemented for self-funding of health insurance.  Also, any pit-falls to avoid would be appreciated also.
title: Self-funded Health Insurance
